cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 625 mi (1005 km) southeast of Bermuda
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating west-northwest across the southwestern Atlantic, then turning northwest to approach the southeast U.S. coastline (centered on the North Carolina/South Carolina border) late Thursday before drifting inland toward Virginia Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of North Carolina near Cape Fear–Cape Lookout

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued yet; interests from South Carolina to Virginia advised to monitor
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern and mid-Atlantic coastline from South Carolina through Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm force winds (35-50 kt) are a 55% risk within the next five days, with a 19% chance of reaching 50 kt; gusts could reach hurricane force if the center passes just south of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3–5+ ft surge in Hampton Roads and lower Chesapeake Bay if the storm tracks near the coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of heavy rainfall possible Friday–Saturday with localized higher amounts, leading to flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and coastal flooding even before landfall; possible prolonged river flooding inland after landfall.
